column4: the little squares at the bottom right of my ubuntu installation that let me organize windows into several desktops
are called what??
workspace switcher?
it is just the names of the workspaces.
right click the workspace switcher, settings. rename them what you want
i right click and ive only got "preferences" and that only changes the number of cols / rows
settings is the same as preferences. sorry for misleading you ;) I have below the number of workspaces a fields to rename the workspaces. which ubuntu version do you use?
so try looking into it again please ;)
im searching the installed software on my comp as we speak
I dont understand what that means for the issue ?
preferences of course
are you running 10.04?
yes
workspace switcher preferences here are: show only current, show all in NO rows, number of workspaces, then comes a field named workspace names ....
got it?
naww.. still checking it out .. im runnig version 2.30.00 .. could i bother you for  your version #?
whats the name of the package you want to know the version of?
thats not a package name ;)
remove it and add it again ..
from the panel .. btw. kernel has nothing todo withthat :)
that is the ubuntu version. kernel is something like 2.6.33-generic or alike

kernel is on little but important software piece in a linux system, it is the core process, managing hardware and other processes (programs). it is only in the back and you graphical environment is totally independent of your kernel version
